did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Materials relate to the Japanese invasion and occupation of the Philippines and the Japanese prison camp at Santo Tomás. The papers include scrapbooks of newspaper clippings and correspondence, newspaper clippings files, a typescript of letters and diary entries describing time spent in the camps, and a roster of prisoners of the Santo Tomás internment camp.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: An American merchant seaman, Hastings lived in Japanese-occupied Philippines during World War II. He was interned by the Japanese at the Santo Tomás internment center in Manila and at the Los Baños (or Sulphur Springs) center from January 8, 1942, until he was repatriated on the S.S. Jean Lafitte, February 22, 1945, arriving in San Francisco on March 30, 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Materials relate to the events of the Japanese invasion and occupation of the Philippines, Japanese prison camps at Santo Tomás and Los Baños (or Sulphur Springs) in the Philippines. The papers include scrapbooks of newspaper clippings and correspondence, newspaper clippings files, a typescript of letters and diary entries describing time spent in the camps, and a roster of prisoners of the Santo Tomás internment camp.

scopecontent.p: Generally consists of news clippings describing the events of the Japanese invasion and occupation of the Philippines, as reported in local papers. Later scrapbooks also include other materials such as correspondence. The series also includes files of clippings, mostly dating from 1944, assumed to be collected materials meant to be pasted into a scrapbook. Arranged by format, then chronologically.

Includes a roster of individuals in the Santo Tomás internment camp, a typescript of letters and diary entries describing time spent in the camps, a list of Asiatic-Pacific Campaign Ribbon awardees, and a nautical map of San Francisco, where Hastings returned after the war. Arranged by format.
